revised_title: Cohesive and Interfacial Failure in Laminate: A Theoretical and Experimental Study
tldr: This study investigates the transition between cohesive and interfacial failure in a laminate, focusing on a Griffith crack meeting a plane perpendicular interface in a thick plate. A theoretical condition for deflexion of the crack is derived, and the results are supported by direct observation of a crack traveling through a transparent rubber block to meet an adhesive interface with identical material. The effects of crack speed, depth, and modulus changes along the crack path are also examined.
